metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of A’rou Superstation from January 1 to December 31, 2021. The site (100.464° E, 38.047° N) was located on a cold grassland surface in the Caodaban village, A’rou Town, Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3033 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45C; 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 and 25 m, towards north), wind speed and direction profile (Windsonic; 1, 2, 5, 10, 15 and 25 m, towards north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 5 m, towards south), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 5 m, towards south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 5 m, towards south, vertically downward), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR-LITE; 5 m, towards south, vertically upward), soil heat flux (HFP01SC; 2 duplicates, -0.06 m, 2 m in the south of tower), soil temperature profile (109; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.06, -0.1, -0.15, -0.2, -0.3, -0.4, -0.6, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6, -2, -2.4, -2.8 and -3.2 m, 3 duplicates in -0.04 m and -0.1 m), and soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.02, -0.04, -0.06, -0.1, -0.15, -0.2, -0.3, -0.4, -0.6, -0.8, -1.2, -1.6, -2, -2.4, -2.8 and -3.2 m, 3 duplicates in -0.04 m and -0.1 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_1 m, Ta_2 m, Ta_5 m, Ta_10 m, Ta_15 m and Ta_25 m; RH_1 m, RH_2 m, RH_5 m, RH_10 m, RH_15 m and RH_25 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_1 m, Ws_2 m, Ws_5 m, Ws_10 m, Ws_15 m and Ws_25 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_1 m, WD_2 m, WD_5 m, WD_10 m, WD_15 m and WD_25 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (μmol/(s m-2)), average soil temperature (TCAV, ℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2) (W/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm_1, Ts_4 cm_2, Ts_4 cm_3, Ts_6 cm, Ts_10 cm_1, Ts_10 cm_2, Ts_10 cm_3, Ts_15 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_30 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, Ts_160 cm, Ts_200 cm, Ts_240 cm, Ts_280 cm and Ts_320 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm_1, Ms_4 cm_2, Ms_4 cm_3, Ms_6 cm, Ms_10 cm_1, Ms_10 cm_2, Ms_10 cm_3, Ms_15 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_30 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, Ms_160 cm, Ms_200 cm, Ms_240 cm, Ms_280 cm and Ms_320 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2021-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2021年1月1日至2021年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游阿柔超级站气象要素梯度观测系统数据。站点位于青海省祁连县阿柔乡草达坂村，下垫面是亚高山山地草甸。观测点的经纬度是100.4643E, 38.0473N，海拔3033m。空气温度、相对湿度、风速传感器分别架设在1m、2m、5m、10m、15m、25m处，共6层，朝向正北；风向传感器架设在10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在2m处；翻斗式雨量计安装在阿柔超级站28m观测塔上；四分量辐射仪安装在5m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在5m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；光合有效辐射仪安装在5m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向上；土壤部分传感器埋设在塔体正南方向2m处，其中土壤热流板（自校正式）（3块）均埋设在地下6cm处；平均土壤温度传感器TCAV埋设在地下2cm、4cm处；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、6cm、10cm、15cm、20cm、30cm、40cm、60cm、80cm、120cm、160cm、200cm、240cm、280cm、320cm处，其中4cm和10cm这两层有三个重复；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、6cm、10cm、15cm、20cm、30cm、40cm、60cm、80cm、120cm、160cm、200cm、240cm、280cm、320cm处，其中4cm和10cm这两层有三个重复。
观测项目有：风速（WS_1m、WS_2m、WS_5m、WS_10m、WS_15m、WS_25m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_1m、WD_2m、WD_5m、WD_10m、WD_15m、WD_25m）(单位：度)、空气温湿度（Ta_1m、Ta_2m、Ta_5m、Ta_10m、Ta_15m、Ta_25m和RH_1m、RH_2m、RH_5m、RH_10m、RH_15m、RH_25m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、光合有效辐射（PAR）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm_1、Ms_4cm_2、Ms_4cm_3、Ms_6cm、Ms_10cm_1、Ms_10cm_2、Ms_10cm_3、Ms_15cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_30cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm、Ms_280cm、Ms_320cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm_1、Ts_4cm_2、Ts_4cm_3、Ts_6cm、Ts_10cm_1、Ts_10cm_2、Ts_10cm_3、Ts_15cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_30cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm、Ts_280cm、Ts_320cm）(单位：摄氏度)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示。（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2021-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，其中假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射仪视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关法（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的EC系统在离地4.5米处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig–Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的显热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区是一个人工绿洲，覆盖着玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于蒸散发的比率。这是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，旨在研究异质土地表面的蒸散发，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型仍能产生可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率及ET的估计。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2，与EC系统的测量结果相比。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

methods: Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data were monitored from an observation network connecting a group of automatic meteorological stations (AMSs). In addition, to capture snow accumulation and ablation processes, snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. High-resolution soil physics datasets were also obtained to capture the freeze-thaw processes from a frozen ground observation superstation.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

This paper introduces the infrastructure of the integrated alpine hydrology observation network in the HRB and the complete datasets collected in recent years. Composed of seven standard hydrometeorological stations, one snow superstation and one frozen ground superstation, the observation network serves as an integrated research platform aiming to provide prominent datasets (e.g., hydrometeorology, snow, and frozen ground) of the hydrometeorological processes in the upper reaches of the HRB, which is expected to support alpine region hydrological model development and simulations along with remote sensing observation.

A comprehensive snow dataset from the Yakou snow superstation has been updated since the summer of 2013. In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近期气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也很常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络的角度研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷严酷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，妨碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作），以及2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。积雪和融雪过程在雅口雪超级站自动测量，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深通过SR50A（美国Campbell）进行测量，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）由GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。

Example.AnswerEn: Snow cover properties were collected from a snow observation superstation using state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. Snow depth was measured by SR50A, which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'gap-free meteorological and hydrological data' mean in data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: “无间隙的气象和水文数据”在数据收集中的意思是指收集到的数据没有时间上的空白或缺失，能够连续、完整地反映气象和水文现象。
Definition.AnswerEn: 'Gap-free meteorological and hydrological data' refers to datasets that are continuously recorded without missing values, ensuring complete temporal coverage. This type of data is crucial for accurately modeling and analyzing hydrological and meteorological processes, as gaps in data can lead to errors or misinterpretations in research findings.
Definition.AnswerCn: “无缺口的气象和水文数据”是指连续记录且没有缺失值的数据集，确保了完整的时间覆盖。这种数据对于准确建模和分析水文和气象过程至关重要，因为数据中的缺口可能导致研究结果中的错误或误解。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for meteorological observations at the A'rou superstation in the Heihe River Basin compare to those used in the Daman superstation in terms of equipment and parameters measured?
Comparison.QuestionCn: A'rou超级站在黑河流域的气象观测数据收集方法与Daman超级站相比，在设备和测量参数方面有什么不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The A'rou superstation employs a comprehensive system for meteorological observations including soil temperature and moisture profiles measured in multiple layers, utilizing various instruments such as automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. In contrast, the Daman superstation uses an eddy covariance system and thermal infrared cameras to measure parameters like air temperature, wind speed, humidity, and surface fluxes, focusing on energy balance and evapotranspiration estimates. Both sites measure four-component radiation and meteorological parameters, but the A'rou superstation is more focused on freeze-thaw cycles and soil hydrothermal processes.
Comparison.AnswerCn: A'rou超级站采用综合气象观测系统，包括在多个层次上测量土壤温度和湿度的仪器，利用自动气象站和超级站进行雪和冻土观测。相比之下，Daman超级站使用涡度协方差系统和热红外相机测量空气温度、风速、湿度和表面通量等参数，重点关注能量平衡和蒸散发估算。两个站点都测量四组分辐射和气象参数，但A'rou超级站更侧重于冻融循环和土壤水热过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations in the Heihe River Basin enhance hydrological modeling compared to relying solely on ground-based data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域，遥感数据与地面观测数据的集成如何增强水文模型的效果，相较于仅依赖地面数据。
Comparison.AnswerEn: Integrating remote sensing data with ground-based observations in the Heihe River Basin enhances hydrological modeling by providing comprehensive spatial coverage and validation for alpine hydrological processes that are difficult to capture with ground-based data alone due to the region's inaccessibility and harsh environmental conditions. Remote sensing data, when assimilated with ground-based observations, can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by offering a broader perspective that accounts for spatial heterogeneity, while ground-based data provide the necessary precision for calibration and validation. This combination helps address uncertainties in remote sensing, especially in the complex terrains of alpine regions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，在黑河流域增强了水文模型的能力，因为它提供了全面的空间覆盖和验证，能够捕捉到难以通过地面数据单独获取的高山水文过程，这主要是由于该地区的可达性差和恶劣的环境条件。遥感数据在与地面观测结合时，可以通过提供更广泛的视角来改善水文过程的预测，从而考虑空间异质性，而地面数据则提供了校准和验证所需的精确性。这种结合有助于解决遥感中的不确定性，特别是在高山地区复杂地形中。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How does the integration of multi-scale observation networks contribute to the understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测网络的整合如何有助于理解高山地区的水文过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of multi-scale observation networks allows for comprehensive data collection across diverse variables such as hydrometeorological conditions, snow cover, and frozen ground. This holistic approach supports the understanding of watershed science, promotes the development of hydrological models, and aids in validating remote sensing products and simulations, ultimately advancing predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测网络的整合使得能够在水文气象条件、雪盖和冻土等多种变量上进行全面的数据收集。这种整体方法支持对流域科学的理解，促进水文模型的发展，并有助于验证遥感产品和模拟，最终推动对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are inherent in data collection in alpine hydrology, and how are these addressed through current observational techniques?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学中，数据收集固有的挑战有哪些，以及当前的观测技术是如何应对这些挑战的？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Data collection in alpine hydrology faces challenges such as harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which can lead to incomplete data collection. These challenges are addressed by deploying advanced observational techniques, such as automatic meteorological stations, snow superstations, and frozen ground observation networks, which capture critical data like snow properties, soil temperatures, and moisture under freeze-thaw cycles. Such comprehensive datasets help overcome accessibility and technological barriers in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯水文学的数据收集过程中，面临着严酷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等挑战，这可能导致数据收集不完整。这些挑战通过部署先进的观测技术来解决，例如自动气象站、雪超级站和冻土观测网络，这些技术能够捕捉到关键数据，如雪的特性、土壤温度和冻融循环下的水分。这些综合数据集有助于克服这些地区的可达性和技术障碍。

These datasets enable the validation and calibration of models, ensuring they accurately represent real-world processes. In arid and semi-arid regions, this is particularly crucial for understanding ecohydrological dynamics, predicting water availability, and assessing the impacts of climate change and human activities on hydrological processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期的水文气象过程数据集提供了一致可靠的数据，作为水文模型的准确强迫数据。这些数据集使模型的验证和校准成为可能，确保它们准确地代表现实世界的过程。在干旱和半干旱地区，这对于理解生态水文动态、预测水资源可用性以及评估气候变化和人类活动对水文过程的影响尤为重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the complexity of accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的复杂性受到哪些因素的影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure in EC flux measurements, the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences, and errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，这主要是由于涡动相关通量测量中能量平衡闭合的不完整、表面与空气温度差异的不确定性，以及从复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, and how does this impact hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在高山地区观察数据稀缺，这对水文模型有什么影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is due to difficulties in access and technological barriers. This scarcity hinders alpine hydrological modeling and research, motivating the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments to provide accurate forcing data, validate remote sensing products, and improve predictive understanding of hydrological processes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍。这种稀缺性阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和研究，促使开发下一代生态观测网络和实验，以提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感产品，并提高对水文过程的预测理解。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might technological barriers and access difficulties in alpine regions affect the development and refinement of observation datasets?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 技术障碍和获取困难在高山地区可能如何影响观测数据集的发展和完善？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Technological barriers and access difficulties in alpine regions can hinder the development and refinement of observation datasets by limiting the availability and quality of collected data. These challenges can inhibit consistent data collection, affect the parameterization of hydrological models, and necessitate the development of advanced observation networks and remote sensing technologies to overcome these limitations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的技术障碍和获取困难可能会阻碍观测数据集的发展和完善，因为它们限制了收集数据的可用性和质量。这些挑战可能会妨碍一致的数据收集，影响水文模型的参数化，并需要开发先进的观测网络和遥感技术来克服这些限制。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives behind establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in alpine hydrology research?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络在阿尔卑斯水文学研究中的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objectives include addressing scientific questions related to providing accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, integrating observation and simulation for better understanding, and understanding how perturbations such as climate change and human activities alter fundamental hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标包括解决与为阿尔卑斯水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据相关的科学问题，整合观测与模拟以更好地理解，以及理解气候变化和人类活动等扰动如何改变基本水文过程。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区开发下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because the scarcity of observation data due to access and technological barriers has hindered alpine hydrological modeling. Developing advanced observation networks and experiments can provide accurate data to improve hydrological models and validate remote sensing data, ultimately enhancing the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为由于获取和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺阻碍了高山水文模型的发展。建立先进的观测网络和实验可以提供准确的数据，以改善水文模型并验证遥感数据，最终增强对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to ensure data quality and consistency in meteorological observations within the alpine hydrology observation network?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高山水文观测网络中，确保气象观测数据质量和一致性的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure data quality and consistency, the data undergoes a series of quality control processes. This includes ensuring daily data completeness, removing duplicate records, and eliminating data that exceeds physical limits or instrument range. Doubtful data is marked, and date-time formats are standardized. Additionally, gap-free meteorological and hydrological data are collected from an observation network of automatic meteorological stations, and high-resolution datasets are obtained from superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保数据质量和一致性，数据经过一系列质量控制过程。这包括确保每日数据的完整性、删除重复记录以及消除超出物理限制或仪器范围的数据。可疑数据会被标记，日期时间格式也会标准化。此外，从自动气象站的观测网络收集无间隙的气象和水文数据，并从超级站获取高分辨率的雪盖和冻土观测数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are followed to measure and validate evapotranspiration components using the TSEB model in heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质土地表面使用TSEB模型测量和验证蒸散发组成部分的程序步骤如下：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To measure and validate evapotranspiration components using the TSEB model, ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures are utilized. The model is applied with these temperatures as inputs, and evapotranspiration is partitioned into evaporation and transpiration components. Validation is done using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance measurements. The soil and canopy component temperatures are derived from thermal infrared images, which are classified and processed to calculate radiometric temperatures. These are then validated against surface radiometric temperatures observed by a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了测量和验证蒸散发组成部分，使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组件温度。该模型以这些温度作为输入，蒸散发被划分为蒸发和蒸腾两个组成部分。验证工作使用稳定的氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差测量进行。土壤和冠层组件温度来自热红外图像，这些图像经过分类和处理以计算辐射温度。随后，这些温度与四组件辐射计观测到的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the collection of comprehensive soil and canopy temperature data to improve the estimation of evapotranspiration components?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以收集全面的土壤和冠层温度数据，以改善蒸散发成分的估算？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The collection of comprehensive soil and canopy temperature data is enabled by using a high-resolution thermal infrared camera to capture thermal images, which are then processed to extract soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures. This approach allows for the accurate separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, crucial for estimating evapotranspiration components.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 通过使用高分辨率热红外相机捕捉热图像，能够收集全面的土壤和冠层温度数据，这些图像随后被处理以提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。这种方法允许准确分离土壤和植被成分的温度，对于估算蒸散发成分至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of automatic meteorological stations and superstations enable the continuous monitoring of alpine hydrological processes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 自动气象站和超级气象站的集成如何实现对高山水文过程的持续监测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of automatic meteorological stations and superstations enables continuous monitoring by providing a distributed and multiscale observation network. This network collects data on various hydrometeorological variables, snow cover, and frozen ground conditions, facilitating long-term data collection essential for understanding alpine hydrological processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站和超级站的集成使得通过提供分布式和多尺度的观测网络实现连续监测成为可能。该网络收集各种水文气象变量、雪盖和冻土条件的数据，促进了长期数据收集，这对于理解高山水文过程至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the precise measurement of snow cover properties and their impact on hydrological processes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得能够精确测量雪盖特性及其对水文过程的影响？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as the use of SR50A ultrasonic sensors for measuring snow depth, GMON for snow water equivalent, and FlowCapt for blowing snow flux have enabled precise measurement of snow cover properties. These instruments allow for detailed observation of snow accumulation and ablation processes, providing data critical for understanding their impact on hydrological processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如使用SR50A超声波传感器测量雪深、GMON测量雪水当量以及FlowCapt测量吹雪通量，使得对雪盖特性的精确测量成为可能。这些仪器能够详细观察雪的积累和融化过程，提供对理解其对水文过程影响至关重要的数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data collection methods in alpine regions face significant challenges despite technological advancements?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管技术进步，阿尔卑斯地区的数据收集方法仍可能面临重大挑战，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Several formidable challenges, including the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 几个严峻的挑战，包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，妨碍了在需要的地方/时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are comprehensive datasets important for advancing predictive understanding of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 全面的数据集对于推动对高山地区水文过程的预测理解至关重要。
Expectation.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models, and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计能够为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the estimation of soil heat conductivity be challenging in the context of alpine hydrology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高山水文学的背景下，土壤热导率的估算可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might an integrated observation network improve the quality and applicability of datasets related to watershed science in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 一个综合观测网络如何提高与高山地区流域科学相关的数据集的质量和适用性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: An integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network, such as the one established in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin, can provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, and allow the evaluation of distributed models. This approach is expected to improve the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络，例如在黑河上游建立的网络，可以为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，并允许评估分布式模型。这种方法预计将改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways can the integration of remote sensing data with ground-based observations enhance the prediction of hydrological processes in complex terrains?
Judgmental.QuestionCn:
遥感数据与地面观测的结合可以通过以下几种方式增强复杂地形中水文过程的预测：

1. 提供大范围的空间数据：遥感技术能够覆盖广泛的区域，获取大范围的地表特征和水文变量信息，而地面观测通常局限于特定地点。

2. 增强时间分辨率：遥感数据可以提供频繁的时间序列信息，帮助捕捉水文过程的动态变化，尤其是在降雨、蒸发和水流等方面。

3. 改进模型参数化：通过将遥感数据与地面观测结合，可以更准确地参数化水文模型，尤其是在复杂地形中，考虑到地形、土壤类型和植被覆盖等因素。

4. 提供高分辨率数据：遥感技术可以提供高空间分辨率的数据，帮助识别和分析小尺度的水文过程，如小流域的水流和径流。

5. 支持数据同化：将遥感数据与地面观测结合，可以通过数据同化技术提高模型的预测能力，减少不确定性。

6. 促进多源数据融合：遥感数据可以与其他类型的数据（如气象、土壤和水文数据）结合，提供更全面的水文过程理解。

7. 识别变化和趋势：遥感技术能够有效监测地表变化，帮助识别水文过程中的长期趋势和突发事件。

8. 提高决策支持能力：通过整合遥感和地面数据，可以为水资源管理、洪水预警和生态保护等提供更可靠的决策支持。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing a broader spatial coverage and continuity that complements the sparse ground-based observations. However, due to complexities of the earth system, these data must be validated and calibrated to address various sources of uncertainties, especially in alpine regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用遥感数据结合数据同化可以通过提供更广泛的空间覆盖和连续性来改善水文过程的预测，从而补充稀疏的地面观测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，这些数据必须经过验证和校准，以应对各种不确定性来源，特别是在高山地区。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't understand the specific challenges faced when collecting data in alpine regions for hydrological modeling.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在高山地区收集数据以进行水文建模时面临的具体挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting data in alpine regions include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. Additionally, the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers hinders hydrological modeling and associated research.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在高山地区收集数据的挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素妨碍了完整和一致的数据收集。此外，由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺也阻碍了水文模型和相关研究的开展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the methods used to ensure the quality and completeness of meteorological data collected over extended periods in remote regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在偏远地区长时间收集的气象数据的质量和完整性确保方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Quality and completeness of meteorological data in remote regions are ensured by establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network. This includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations, along with a wireless sensor network to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在偏远地区，气象数据的质量和完整性通过建立一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的观测网络来确保。这包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站，以及一个无线传感器网络，以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the methods used to ensure the quality and consistency of the meteorological data collected in the alpine region observation networks.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述用于确保高山地区观测网络收集的气象数据质量和一致性的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The quality and consistency of the meteorological data are ensured through several measures: collecting data every 10 minutes to capture temporal changes, using robust sensors for various environmental parameters, and implementing quality control steps such as marking missing data and removing outliers or erroneous readings. Furthermore, data are processed to maintain uniform formats and naming conventions, as seen with the AWS+ station naming rule.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 气象数据的质量和一致性通过多项措施得以确保：每10分钟收集一次数据以捕捉时间变化，使用稳健的传感器测量各种环境参数，并实施质量控制步骤，如标记缺失数据和去除异常值或错误读数。此外，数据经过处理以保持统一的格式和命名规范，例如AWS+站点命名规则。
